pageContext.claim: “We had a case, I guess in New Jersey, you were reading to me, where somebody was sent two ballots, and they had slightly -- one was -- had a hyphen in it, the name, and the other one had a "K." And they got two names. So I wonder if that person was a Democrat. Probably was.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump once again seizes on a minor glitch to suggest electoral malfeasance by Democrats. But often these problems are caused by voters themselves, as noted by an article in The Patch titled "Get A Wrong Or Duplicate Ballot? It Is Probably Your Fault." The article quoted a New Jersey county clerk as saying here are many reasons why these errors occur, but most boil down the a database being only as good as as its source material.
